search_information.business: Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Atlanta East

comment.text: Service was fast and friendly. First time ever. Great quality and true to the menu ( spice levels are no joke lol) Nice outside sitting.

photos.caption: Fried Sandwich damn, that's hot- spice level. Pimento Mac and Cheese

comment.text: The restaurant was clean and had enough seating inside and outside. Our cashier was very knowledgeable about the menu and gave great recommendations. The service was spot on and very fast. So fast by the time we got our drinks the food was on our table. The portions were plentiful and none of us could finish our meal. The chicken was flavorful and the loaded fries were mm mm good. I found a chicken spot and will be back for more!
Fantastic fried chicken in a no-frills fast food setting. The staff is excellent - very welcoming and friendly.

Their sides were good, and the chicken was ok. I would not go out if my way to choose them.

I did enjoy the outside eating area as an option to dine.

If you are looking for traditional soul food  and its nearby check them out
Very yummy!!! Chicken sandwich was hot (spicy) but not too hot. And the banana pudding! Wanna go back just to order that! And it looked cute inside with the roasters.
Good service. The staff was patient with me when I gave up on the McClucken chicken sandwich. My nose was on fire After the first bite. The peach cobbler was lovely

Perfect food stop for beer and fries ... and chicken

Located right off of Moreland near the Dekalb Avenue offramp (before Target and Little Five Points).  Parking is very tight but spots open up fairly quickly.  There is a nice picnic table seating outside and in the shade... music playing inside and outside.

The food is reasonably priced, there was no wait, and ALL of the staff are friendly and patient.  

You can find good fried food and beer all over the City but but chose this restaurant for a chill and friendly atmosphere and convenient location.

I've been a frequent visitor to this location since the week it opened. Having gone to the originator--Prince's Hot Chicken Shack in Nashville--an Atlanta purveyor of Nashville Hot Chicken was welcomed.  

Today, for the first time, I ordered a large white chicken mild.  My go to heat is either medium or hot but today I wasn't feeling anything to hot. When my order arrived, it looked as if the hot sauce had been poured across the chicken. I took the two chicken breasts up to the counter, and said that it just looked different to which they replied, OK.  They told me that that is how mild chicken is served. I told them that I had not ordered mild chicken at all. When I'd previously been there by myself or with family and friends, I'd only ordered medium or hotter so I had no idea. I'd figured the chicken would be coated like they coat medium and hotter chicken. 

They asked what I would prefer, and I basically said give me the medium.   When they returned with the two chicken breasts, they were dripping with seasoning and they were oily which overpowered the heat.  I don't like food waste but I knew I could not eat what they'd served. I sent it back and requested mild and some sauce.  

Their manager returned to the table with one chicken breast, basically saying "here's your order".  I recapitulated the aforementioned story.  He listened and was also focused on my phone on one table and water bottle on another--I'd left them there as we were getting settled in. He said "someone left their phone". I told him it was mine. He then looked at the Fiji bottle then pointed to it asking if it was mine. "Yes, it's my bottle". Then he said "oh three tables" and commented about needing space for his customers.  It took another 8 minutes before my second chicken breast was delivered.   As I awaited my order it was apparent that I was not his customer. 

Two servers offered impeccable service.  The manager on duty today did not.

Always so good!!! I love Hattie's everything is good, hot and taste amazing! The chicken wings, chicken tenders and Mac and cheese are my favorite but the pickles gets me every time! I always ask for extra, extra lol and a side of ranch! You must try!

Hot chicken is what you get here! I came on a Wednesday and there was no line. We parked right in the front and walked in. I ordered the chicken sandwich combo and my son had the tenders with fries and Mac. My flavor was mild and it was still hot so it definitely lived up to its name. The fries were tasty, fresh and seasoned. The mac was ok. As far as the sandwich itself, my chicken Brest was slightly dry and it's probably due to the size of the beast. The flavor wasn't anything special, hence why I gave it a three star. Seems that the emphasis is on the spice level instead of the actual flavor. I would say it's more so a tourist spot that's hyped up. When I told my friend who's from Atlanta about it, he said "you had to see for yourself...chick fil-A is better." 

The location was clean and the workers were friendly. The food came out fast! We ate outside and there were fans to keep us from melting in the summer heat. Would I recommend...probably not. To be honest, I like Scoville Hot chicken in Alpharetta way better.

Just had the best time at Hattie B's. The food is terrific and the beer selection is perfect from nice variety on tap including Bearded Iris to Miller High Life in 40oz bottles. We really enjoyed out chicken sandwiches, chicken pieces, fried pickles and sides. But the staff makes the experience even better. Everyone was friendly, helpful and just genuinely nice and fun to be around. When our table of 7 was brave enough to try the Shut The Cluck Up level chicken, a very caring team member rescued us with scoops of ice cream. We've already talked about how we need to do this again soon.

Mild to moderately obsessed with this place. I always order it to go (in advance) so I don't have to wait in line. There is always a line. I think I like this place the best because they have grilled chicken. You don't have to get the fried stuff (which I know is great, but not when you don't want something so heavy). It's the tenders for me. 
Three giant grilled tenders. Occasionally I'll get a wild hair and get one fried, 2 grilled. It's best to do this in person, though. Medium is usually hot enough for me. any hotter and it's just an uncomfortable eating experience, and I can't taste the flavor. It's just hot. So, mild or medium- plus the ranch. I get the bread on the side so it's not covered in the hot stuff. 

For sides, I typically do double potato salad. This time, they had cheesy grits, so I tried those- yum! I don't like grits, but these were more of a potato than a grit to me. Peach cobbler for dessert. And I don't even really like peaches. 

Parking is usually a pain, but there's a paid lot Nextdoor. If you're lucky, you'll score a free spot behind the building or in the few spots they have.

photos.caption: Grilled Jumbo Tenders Plate- what's left of it...

comment.text:
Hot chicken hot chicken that it was lol , Hattie B's Hot Chicken , hmm let's see i had the chance to try this place out for a quick late night bite to eat around 10:30pm - 11ish , which was definitely worth it besides fast food even though this food was prepared pretty fast 10 min to be exact not to bad at all . We got the food to go because it was already to late plus we had the kids but the restaurant do have the opinion to sit inside or sit outside which i can't remember what the inside sitting looked like i just know it was not all that big but outside definitely had picnic tables with over head tents where you have a street view of the cars going by or pulling up which is not to bad depending on the weather i think the outside seating looked better plus i believe music was playing as well. 

Over all ratting of the restaurant 6/10 
Mac and cheese 4/10
Bake beans 6/10
Hot chicken mild wings 7/10 some reason the mild was very spicy 
Banana pudding 7/10
Collard greens 6/10
Peach cobbler 7/10
Waffles 4/10

Some how the Mac and cheese, bake beans , the slice of bread and the 3 wings was all spicy and i asked for a mild flavor.

Excellent!  Wonderful food and excellent service!  We like that you choose a chicken option ( like tenders or small white) then your level of heat.  There's Southern if you do t want heat.  Great sides like collards, pimento Mac and cheese, baked beans and homemade banana pudding.  Wish I loved closer!  I would eat here all the time.

photos.caption: Small white, greens and pimento Mac and cheese

comment.text:
Came in to check out this spot around 1:30 in afternoon on a Sunday. It was already getting busy with patrons when we arrived. The line was confusing as there was not a lot of room to do a straight line back unless you lined up out the door into the outdoor seating area. We figured it out and made our order. I got the two piece small dark with two sides. 
Kara was honest with me about the banana pudding after I told her what I have to have in a bp. I appreciate her honesty
It took 10 minutes to get our order to go and we were out. 
They seemed to have plenty workers which is a plus in this economy. The people dining in seemed to be enjoying their meals. 
As for my food, the chicken wasn't seasoned so that was unfortunate. I think this spot is best for those who like to have the spice to their chicken. I don't do spice so I got the plain chicken. The greens were plain as well with no seasoning or ham. The potato salad had a nice taste to it. 
I wouldn't go back but I think again this is great for those who like spicy chicken.

photos.caption: Dark meat plate with potato salad and geeens

comment.text:
So good...Made the 35 mins drive to 5 Points and would do it again!!

The boy had the chicken sandwich.  Forgot which level of spice he ordered but he was glad he didn't order the next level up.  Sandwich was huge and he was only able to eat half.  He thoroughly enjoyed the mac n cheese!

My two piece platter was also enjoyable. I'd probably get the mac n cheese instead of the potato salad.  It was good, but the others were better.

photos.caption: Small Dark Plate, Creamy Red Skinned Potato Salad, and grits
Fried Sandwich with Pimento Mac and Cheese

comment.text: Dined in at Hattie's while visiting Atlanta for the first time and it was DELICIOUS . The first words out of my mouth when I bit into my grilled chicken was WOW. It was juicy, soft and full of so much flavor - I couldn't stop eating. The fires are seasoned and come with a little kick, one of the best crinkled fries I've tasted. Will definitely return whenever we visit GA again.
Awesome place to eat. Cool atmosphere. Very good. Great fries and I love the peach cobbler. The staff is also very friendly. Thank you Hattie B's!

Hattie Bs is a staple of the south for good southern cooking and hot chicken. And while I can't speak for all Hattie Bs I can say that this one is the gold standard for service. We had a large party a couple of weeks back - lots of kids. And they were super helpful and accommodating. While this isn't typically a place for table service, one of the employees took it upon himself to run drinks and grab trash. He even helped me order waffles rather than standing in line so my son could steal mine. If you are in the area, go experience good food and southern hospitality!!

owner_replies.comment: Mandy! This is so awesome to hear and thank you so much for the feedback.

comment.text: Visited Hattie B's for a catering order of 35 chicken tenders (a big hit for kids' birthday parties) and encountered a minor hiccup with the spiciness level. The staff handled it like total pros! Not only did they promptly remake the entire order, but they also offered complimentary fries for my son and me while we waited. Great customer service.

owner_replies.comment: Hey Andrew, thank you for sharing the love and hope the birthday party was a hit!

comment.text: I had the half chicken meal. The chicken was delicious and the hot was deliciously HOT! My sides were grits and greens, and the greens had a small piece of foil in them.  The grits were okay, flavorful. I may be a bit biased due to the fact that I've had Hattie B's while in Nashville and the food was amazing all around. This location could use some cleaning. I did want to wash my hands, but the bathroom was disgusting, so I walked out and used the hand wipes at the tables instead. The service was good. Everyone was very pleasant.
What's to say that hasn't been said?!  Glad to have passed by on a weekday afternoon when it wasn't too busy. Been anxious to get back ever since.

The chicken did what it was supposed to do!  Juicy and delicious!  Make sure you know the hot level is HOTTING!!!  The greens were slamming, mac and cheese is so-so (not a pimento cheese fan) and most of the sides are good. 

The wait area for the food is a little hectic,  and they need another space for Uber Eats and all the delivery services to pick up.  It jacks up the crowd around the order and pickup area.  The wait has gone down now, but the lemonade/Arnold Palmer makes it worth the wait!

I'd been to Hattie B's a few years ago and finally came back for another visit! Absolutely love their hot chicken.

Parking at Hattie's can be a little tricky (you enter at one side and then drive behind the building for parking behind or later in the front). But there's plenty of seating and service is pretty quick. I recommend the Hot Chicken Sandwich because seriously, this chicken is HOT, and the pickles, comeback sauce, and coleslaw on top help balance the heat (I normally am not a coleslaw person but theirs rocks!!). I also love their crinkle cut fries and suggest getting extra comeback sauce to go with them. My boyfriend got the quarter dark with collard greens and pimento cheese, which were all very good as well. 

Overall, Hattie B's Hot Chicken really does live up to the name, and definitely worth a visit if you're in the area!
So we were looking for delicious food and Hattie B's nailed it!! WARNING: hot is good hot and dam hot is well dam hot!! Great service and so nice and cool inside!

photos.caption: Chicken sandwich dam hot!! Flavor and bacon grits
Half chicken and Mac n cheese

comment.text:
We ordered a large catering order for the office. We had food for over 40 people. I loved how the food was packaged. We were able to get chicken sandwiches as well as chicken tendered. We also got an order of the mac and cheese and an order of the cold slaw. For dessert they had banana pudding individually packaged and apple pie. 

It was easy to set up and have a buffet style. The team was able to come up and either make a plate or grab one of the boxes with the chicken sandwiches. It was easy to feed the time in a time efficient manor. Also everyone loved it because they were able to choose how spicy they wanted their chicken. 

I loved the spicy one but it has a kick to it. I also loved all the dipping sauces that came with the chicken. My favorite combination was the ranch and the spicy chicken. I also loved the mac and cheese and I wish I would have had space for the banana pudding. I would order from them again.

The hype is real. The chicken is moist and flavorful . Perfectly seasoned to be spicy yet slightly sweet. I'm coming back . They even have Mexican coke in the glass bottle, my fav 

FYI parking is tight but there's a pay lot next door. Expect a line, but it goes quick.

Hands down my favorite fried chicken at all time. We had the mild and the southern one. Skin is crunchy and the meat is so juicy and tender. The bread on the bottle soaked up the sauce from the chicken was very yum. We also enjoyed the side dishes. My brother and sister in law who don't care for cole slaw likes them a lot. The Mac and cheese was very creamy. The root beer float was ok, nothing special. Ambiance is pretty hip much better than your regular fast food place. The service was excellent. Wish there is one in Jersey, will definitely go back again next time we are in Georgia.

We order Hattie B's any chance we get! I love the hot chicken sandwich and the jumbo tenders. The tenders are pretty large so only getting 3 tenders is definitely enough! The coleslaw is so perfect with the damn hot flavor - the perfect balance.

Like I died and went to chicken heaven.......

The wings, the sandwiches, the Mac and cheese with the hot chicken and pickles on top. 

All were delish and had us wishing we had time for another visit before we left town. 

My only advice.....get the full menu over to the Hattie's in Las Vegas pretty please!!!!

Had some family visiting and went straight from the airport to Hattie B's to cure the hunger.  I was pleasantly surprised.  At first glance, it looks very small, but when you walk in, there is plenty of seating.  The cashier who took our order was pleasant and helped us decide on option.  I ordered the tenders - mild with a side of fries and pimento Mac n cheese.  Glad we stopped in.  We sat outside in the patio and enjoyed the beautiful day with the overhead heaters to take away the chill.  The tenders had a nice crunch and the spice level was perfect and not over powering.  My eyes were bigger than my stomach so couldn't finish the entire meal.  Will definitely be back again.

I loveeeeeee me some Hattie B's. I don't think I've ever had a a bad experience here! The chicken is always hot, juicy and fresh. The staff is always friendly and even if there's a line, they usually move pretty quick. I love that you can sit outside, it makes casual dining unique here! If you ever have a taste for Authentic Nashville Hot Chicken, pull up to Hattie B's. They won't disappoint!

This was on top of the most recommended place to check out on several of my friend's curated Atlanta must-see lists. I made it my priority to fit this into any itinerary I had. Location is a bit away from the other places I wanted to go to, but I can say it's definitely worth trek!

Even going with high expectations, the hot chicken sandwiches here definitely lived up to the hype. I got the hot chicken with medium spicy level and a side of crinkle fries. The spice they put on the fries were also really good, a reminiscent to old bay seasoning. The hot chicken sandwich itself was very juicy and flavorful to every bite. I'm still thinking about it til this day!

Overall; I highly recommend adding this to your to-do list in ATL if you're on the fence! Also do expect to wait on line depending on what time of day you come. We waited maybe 10-15 minutes at 1pm Saturday afternoon.

Hattie B's is somewhere where I don't crave that much, but when I do come here, I do enjoy my experience every time. I was able to come here to grab some lunch with co-workers and though this place is literally all the way downtown, it was worth the drive.

Beware -- Hattie B's doesn't have the best parking so you may get confused or lost parking, but once you endure that part, everything afterwards will be great! 

I ordered the chicken sandwich with mild seasoning (I usually get the medium but I didn't want to get a too spicy lunch) and I got it with the fries. I also got some ranch sauce for my sandwich. Mild seasoning was perfect; it had exactly a really mild kick and it was the perfect flavoring! The chicken patty also had a bit of a sweet flavor which was very nice. 

The chicken patty was really meaty and jam packed; it isn't your usual chicken sandwich. There's truly a lot of flavor and plenty of chicken to go around, which makes the sandwich really appetizing. It comes with a pickle, and for the cost (~$13), it's truly worth it! 

I want to try the medium again next time as the mild really didn't have much spice but this most recent experience made me redevelop my appreciation for Hattie B's. If you live in ATL, you need to check this place out!
Sandwiches were super old/dry. Not the same as the Nashville locations at all but not terrible. Probably just came on an off day

owner_replies.comment: Hey Brandon, we are sorry to hear about your experience with us. If you want to drop us a line at info@hattieb.com we would love to rectify this. Thank you!

comment.text: 10/10 would RECOMMEND!!! Believe the hype. This place is so delicious!!! I ordered a chicken sandwich with a side of baked beans, coleslaw on the side and the amazingly delicious come back sauce!!!!
Came here to get some chicken a few years ago and baby it was good and fresh. I would go back here anytime I visited atl. The customer service was good. No complaints at all.

AMAZING! The restaurant is a little tucked away and you could easily miss it, but the food is so worth it! Staff was very friendly and helpful in decision making. I would personally recommend the medium spiciness if you want a kick of flavor. There's also a non-spicy option for those who would prefer it.
I would definitely come here again next time I'm in Atlanta. Thankfully there's also a Dallas location so I can enjoy this delicious food again!

photos.caption: Our chicken meals with pimento mac and cheese, Creamy Red Skinned Potato Salad, and a Large Peach Cobbler.

comment.text:
Love Hattie B's! Having lived in Nashville for a few years, this was definitely our go to spot! 

The customer service was amazing. Everyone was super friendly and the food came out super fast and hot. 

The line wasn't long at all for lunch on a Thursday. We got the tenders (mild) and wings (hot) with pimento mac & cheese, greens, and fries on the side. 

Docking off a few stars for the banana pudding, mac & cheese, portion of the fries, and parking. 

The banana pudding's consistency was off. It was very very mushy with an odd taste to it. Maybe we just had a bad batch? Kind of sad because we usually devour it, but this time we got halfway and just gave up. 

The pimento mac and cheese was a bit on the dry side. Usually they have it pretty creamy with a hint of zest from the pimento, but this one was neither. 

The portion of the fries was pretty little. We're used to having to take our fries home because it was so much. Lol. This time we finished our fries before we finished our chicken. 

Pretty tight squeeze into the lot with super limited parking. There is a lot right next door, but you do have to pay for parking. 

Overall a 3. We would come back because we love Hattie B's. But it definitely isn't like the one in Nashville.

photos.caption: Fried Tender Pimento Mac and Cheese Crinkle Cut French Fries Small Banana Pudding

comment.text:
This Hattie B's Hot Chicken location can be found next door (in a separate parking lot) to a Sherwin- Williams Paint store. Parking is pretty limited and we were very lucky to get the last parking spot on a Tuesday evening a little before 7 pm.

We waited in a line to get inside (as there was a sign to allow only so many people to come inside, to social distance. After we looked over the menu, we ended up ordering:

Large Dark Plate, $12 prior to tax- This item comes with sides, in which my husband picked Bacon Cheddar Grits and Black Eyed Peas Salad. I didn't have any of my husband's chicken but he thought it was good. The grits was very good and probably one of the best grits I have ever had (probably because there was bacon and cheese in it). The salad was okay.

Fried Jumbo Tenders Plate, $11 prior to tax- My entre comes with sides, in which I ended up picking Crinkle Cut French Fries and Southern Collared Greens. The fries were a major disappointment. They were soggy and cold. The collared greens were good. The jumbo tenders were pretty big but were also cold on the inside. Quite disappointed and had to reheat them in the microwave (since we ordered this to go. I hate to think I would have eaten cold chicken if I was dining in).

Large Apple Clobber, $4 prior to tax- My husband ordered this. This dessert wasn't bad but maybe a little too sweet for me. My husband thought the same.
-----------------------
(Total= $25.05 after tax)

Service was friendly when we made our order with the employee behind the register. I really liked this employee, she made me laugh when I was placing my order. I think in general, all the employees we interacted with were friendly.

While we sat at a table waiting for our to go order, I was surprised to see people checking their to go orders. There were a few people that seemed to have missing items from their order (I think they may have made their order online or via phone). But luckily we weren't missing anything from our order.

I was rather disappointed with this place and was expecting more, especially since it is so highly rated on Yelp (overall rating of 4.5 stars with over 1750 reviews at this time of this review). I wouldn't come back if I lived in this area.

photos.caption: Large Dark Plate, $12 prior to tax. Shown with Bacon Cheddar Grits, Black Eyed Peas Salad as sides and Large Apple Clobber, $4 prior to tax
Fried Jumbo Tenders Plate, $11 prior to tax, shown with Crinkle Cut French Fries and Southern Collared Greens as the sides
Large Dark Chicken Plate, $12 prior to tax. Please note that two sides that come with meal is not shown

comment.text: Having just a couple hours in Atlanta, my fianc and I had one thing in the mind - fried chicken. Hattie B's is the real deal! The fried chicken is spicy and delicious, the Mac and cheese is super creamy, and the potato salad is loaded with lots of their not so secret ingredient (bacon). Everything was so good, we would definitely go back again if we could. Is it healthy? No, but if you're looking for healthy don't go to a fried chicken place.

photos.caption: Fried  Chicken Tenders, Pimento Mac and Cheese, and Creamy Red Skinned Potato Salad

comment.text:
Lots of hype entering this place and maybe it was a victim of unusually high expectations. I got a chicken sandwich with all the fixins (medium heat), pimento Mac, and peach cobbler. It was a solid sandwich and a tasty meal, but it wasn't anything memorable. Luckily I had no line when I entered and the service was very very friendly!

Sandwich was decent but I kept feeling like it was just missing something. Maybe I should've gotten Hot because I felt like it was missing some depth of flavor. There was a decently light crisp, but again, nothing spectacular. Sandwich looked good though. 

The Mac was very disappointing and tasted pretty bland. I think it would be boosted so much if it had some jalapeos in it. 

The peach cobbler was just decent as well. Although I will say when I put some of the cobbler jam on the sandwich, it really heightened my experience with the sweet salty contrast.

Overall I'm glad I went but I would be OK not going again when I visit Atlanta.

The food was pretty decent, the Mac and cheese wasn't bad but it wasn't anything special either. The environment was kinda loud but wasn't overwhelming. If you are looking for something quick to eat otw home this wouldn't be a bad place to grab food.
The service was so amazing. I loved it. The food was great. I can't wait to try it again and the ambiance was chill, nice and clean and fully stocked with items we needed.
Off the top-hat-absolutely delicious!! Must try and be for-warned, is hauntingly addictive. Super unhealthy but OMG, worth a splurge

Saw the reviews for amazing fried chicken and had to stop by. Place looks trendy, but my focus is on the taste. Ordered half a bird and waited only about 10 minutes to get it. I ran back to my car since parking was scarce and where I parked there was a concern about possibly getting towed. My Fianc and I grabbed a piece each, looked at each other, and then took a bite. Unfortunately, the result was nothing special.. just average fried chicken that you can get at most places..

Download the app for a free dessert on your first visit! 

I ordered my meal on the app online and picked it up at the counter when I arrived. There was a line, so I'm glad I ordered online. 

The chicken was hot and served on a piece of toast (and a pickle). I got the flavor after hot, and it was certainly HOT. the chicken was a little fatty/had a little slime (like most places do). I cleaned around it and ate it. It was good, but a little salty. The fries were also salty--a little too salty for me. I enjoyed the plate overall and will likely be back (for my free dessert :))

Absolutely love this place! We first tried Hattie B'a in Alabama and when we realized there was one in Atlanta we had to pay it a visit! I was curious to see if it was as good as the first time and also if was as good in another state. Well it didn't disappoint! I ordered the half bird mild and it was delicious. For sides I had Mac n cheese and greens  and they were both good but the Mac n cheese wasn't as good as I remembered but not bad. My husband tried the cheesy grits; they were actually good for fast food place. We also tried the waffles which were delicious as well. Another person in our party had the potato salad and it was delicious as well. I think it's safe to say that pretty much everything on the menu is delicious. If you're in a town that has a Hattie B's then it would behoove you try it, you won't regret it! One last comment..,,the homemade lemonade is the best!!

photos.caption: Pimento Mac and Cheese and  Southern Collard Greens

comment.text: Amazing!!! The hot chicken here is the best I've ever had and the sides are really good too.  Be prepared for a wait tho!
Food is still awesome years later...best fried chicken in Atlanta period. Best peach cobbler I've tasted in Atlanta.
